title: Mehdi Ghayedi
text:
Mehdi Ghayedi (, born 5 December 1998) is an Iranian professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">Forward</a> or <a href="second%20striker">second striker</a> for <a href="UAE%20Pro%20League">UAE Pro League</a> club <a href="Shabab%20Al%20Ahli%20Club">Shabab Al Ahli</a> and the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national team</a>.
Club career.
Iranjavan.
Ghayedi was born in <a href="Bushehr">Bushehr</a>, Iran, and started his career at youth level with <a href="F.C.%20Iranjavan%20Bushehr">Iranjavan Bushehr</a>. He was promoted to the senior squad before the start of the 2016–17 and scored 10 times. He was named as the <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a> young player of the season for the 2016–17 season in July 2017.
Esteghlal.
On 8 June 2017, Ghayedi signed a three-year contract with <a href="Esteghlal%20F.C.">Esteghlal</a>, upon signing for Esteghlal, he was given the number 16.
At the start of the season the <a href="Football%20Federation%20Islamic%20Republic%20of%20Iran">FFIRI</a> banned him from playing along with two fellow Esteghlal teammates <a href="Majid%20Hosseini">Majid Hosseini</a> and <a href="Omid%20Noorafkan">Omid Noorafkan</a> as <a href="Alireza%20Mansourian">Alireza Mansourian</a> prevented them to join <a href="Iran%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Iran under-23</a> camp. The deprivation from the FFIRI was finally cancelled on 29 July 2017 after missing the first week of the season and the players eligible to play for the second week of the 2017–18 campaign. He finally made his debut for Esteghlal on 4 August 2017, in a 0–0 draw against <a href="Esteghlal%20Khuzestan%20F.C.">Esteghlal Khuzestan</a> entering the match as a substitute for Omid Noorafkan. At the end of the match, even though he played for a few minutes, he was praised for his skills and effort. After making his debut he became the youngest player to play for the club in the <a href="Persian%20Gulf%20Pro%20League">league</a>, a record which was held by Omid Noorafkan previously.
Ghayedi started his first match for the club in a 3–0 victory over <a href="Sepahan%20F.C.">Sepahan</a> on 6 December. On 25 January 2018, Esteghlal was awarded a penalty after a foul on Ghayedi which was converted by <a href="Server%20Djeparov">Server Djeparov</a> in the 4–0 victory against <a href="F.C.%20Pars%20Jonoubi%20Jam">Pars Jonoubi Jam</a>; he also assisted <a href="Ali%20Ghorbani%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201990%29">Ali Ghorbani</a>'s goal in the same match. He was named the man of the match for his performance.
On 29 January, Ghayedi was involved in a serious car crash in his hometown <a href="Bandar%20Bushehr">Bushehr</a> along with his friends and his cousin who died a few days later. As result of the accident, he went through a surgery due to his Spleen being damaged by trauma and was ruled out for the rest of the season. A day later Esteghlal beat <a href="Sanat%20Naft%20Abadan%20F.C.">Sanat Naft</a> in <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Hazfi%20Cup%23Sixth%20Round%20%28Semi-Final%29">Hazfi Cup</a> and his teammates dedicated the victory to him. In August 2021, Ghayedi was linked with a move to Qatari side <a href="Al-Gharafa%20SC">Al-Gharafa</a>.
Shabab Al Ahli.
On 23 August 2021, Ghayedi transferred to <a href="Shabab%20Al%20Ahli%20Club">Shabab Al Ahli</a> <a href="Dubai">Dubai</a> on a five-year contract.
International career.
Youth.
Ghayedi was selected to join <a href="Iran%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Iran under-20</a> to take part in the <a href="2017%20FIFA%20U-20%20World%20Cup">2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup</a>, under manager <a href="Amir%20Hossein%20Peiravani">Amir Hossein Peiravani</a>. After sitting on the bench for Iran's opening match against <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a>, he made his tournament debut against <a href="Zambia%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Zambia</a> and played for 18 minutes in Iran's 4–2 defeat. He also played for a few minutes against <a href="Portugal%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Portugal</a> as Iran lost the match and was knocked out of the competition.
Senior.
On 4 October 2020, <a href="Dragan%20Sko%C4%8Di%C4%87">Dragan Skočić</a> called Ghayedi up for <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> against <a href="Uzbekistan%20national%20football%20team">Uzbekistan</a>. On 8 October 2020, he made his senior international debut against Uzbekistan.
Style of play.
Ghayedi often uses <a href="Nutmeg%20%28association%20football%29">nutmeg</a> skill for dribbling in one-on-one situations.
